title: Soho House wins $100m investment despite widening losses
text:
Private members' club network Soho House has netted a $100m (£78m) investment to fund expansion around the world, despite a rise in losses.

The company, which has 26 sites around the world, sold a 5pc stake to investors led by serial entrepreneur Bippy Siegal’s Raycliff Capital with a significant investment from US billionaire David Simon’s Simon Property Group. The deal values it at $2bn.

Founder Nick Jones, The Ivy restaurant owner Richard Caring and American billionaire Ron Burkle remain Soho House’s majority investors.

It came as the group revealed losses of £65m in 2018, up £5m on a year earlier.
